metadata.title: CVE-2022-42856 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A type confusion issue was addressed with improved state handling. Thisissue is fixed in Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 15.7.2and iPadOS 15.7.2, iOS 16.1.2. Processing maliciously crafted web contentmay lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that thisissue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS releasedbefore iOS 15.1..

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42856` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
